lead_paragraph: REINSBERG--Kurt E.,(99), passed away peacefully of natural causes at his home in Scarsdale, NY the evening of Saturday, April 23rd. Born November 3, 1916 in Brussels, Belgium to Clara and Lehmann Reinsberg, he was raised in Cologne, Germany and moved in 1937 to New York City, where he met his beloved late wife of 53 years, Susie. He spent 44 years at Associated Metal and Minerals Corporation, where he built a distinguished career as a pioneer of international trade. A lover of history and travel, he also enjoyed writing and painting. He was chairman of the Metals and Mining Division of UJA-Federation, a founding board member of the JCC of Mid-Westchester, a trustee of the Beth Israel Nursing Home, and a supporter of genetic research of Parkinson's Disease at Mount Sinai Beth Israel. He was the devoted father of Nicole and John (Lori), and loving grandfather of Zachary (Melissa), Daniel, Gregory, Hillary, Justin, and Evan. Services will be held at Congregation Rodeph Sholom, 7 W. 83rd St., this Tuesday at noon. 1/3
